questions.question: We have got ………………………… expensive clothes for the fuller figure.
questions.description: Less is the comparative form of little.

questions.question: We are going …………………………….
questions.description: We use double comparatives to indicate that something is changing.

questions.question: …………………………. now own a car.
questions.description: We use double comparatives to indicate that something is changing.

questions.question: You are getting ………………………………
questions.description: We use double comparatives to indicate that something is changing.

questions.question: The more he works, …………………………
questions.description: In this construction, the word order in both clauses is ‘the + comparative + subject + verb’.

questions.question: The population of China is ………………………….
questions.description: The population of China cannot be greater than India. It can only be greater than the population of India. We add the expression ‘that of’ to express that idea.

questions.question: Who is …………………………. person ever to climb Mt. Everest?
questions.description: We use the before the superlative.

questions.question: She is the brightest student ………………………… the class.
questions.description: After superlatives we use ‘in’ with a singular noun referring to a place or group.

questions.question: She was the nicest person ………………………………… them all.
questions.description: After superlatives, of can be used before plurals.

questions.question: She earns more than …………………………….
questions.description: Object pronouns are more common after than. Subject pronouns can also be used with verbs.

questions.question: She looks ………………………. than her daughter.
questions.description: We can use the adverb'no' to modify comparatives.

questions.question: This restaurant is ………………………… than that restaurant.
questions.description: The expression 'a little' can be used to modify comparatives.
